image.altText: CFA battle a fast moving grass fire which gets close to homes in Craigieburn on February 9, 2014

props.synopsis: Grassland in Victoria has dried significantly since September, including in the north-west of the state and in outer Melbourne, putting firefighters on edge.

title.children: As Victoria's grassland dries, the CFA warns of increased fire risk

image.altText: A vehicle with a Happy Chanukah! sign that has sustained fire damage.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested in connection to an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man arrested in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne

image.altText: drawing of a young girl using the phone in bed at night, next to an image of a man on a laptop in a hoodie.

props.synopsis: Child safety experts say the case of a 13-year-old girl who became pregnant while in state care highlights the dangers of the residential system.

title.children: Teenage girl sexually assaulted and pregnant while in state care

image.altText: A person leans on an oval fence while kids stand nearby with bikes in front of a large round hole in the green grass.

props.synopsis: A sinkhole has opened up in Banyule Flats Reserve, close to where a North East Link tunnel boring machine is operating.

title.children: North East Link tunnel works being investigated as sinkhole opens in park

image.altText: Birds eye view of a housing estate with an oval and park towards the bottom of the image

props.synopsis: Thousands of young trees dot the streets and front gardens of this outer Melbourne suburb as part of a neighbourhood-wide push to create more shade and curb the urban heat island effect.

title.children: Tree by tree, this new suburb is dodging baking heat in summer

image.altText: Richard Turner looks over his shoulder looking stern and serious, with his arms slightly folded in front of him.

props.synopsis: When survivors of child sexual abuse receive compensation, many may have to repay Centrelink, Medicare and private health insurance amounts relating to their abuse.

title.children: Insurance, Centrelink repayments 'final nail in coffin' for abuse survivors

image.altText: Blonde woman wearing red T-shirt and jeans with arms up.

props.synopsis: Dozens of people from multiple states have come forward after allegedly falling victim to a new pet and house-sitting scam orchestrated by career con artist Patricia McIntyre.

title.children: Serial fraudster allegedly targeting pet and home owners in scam

image.altText: The rural driveway of a prison with a sign reading "Langi Kal Kal"

props.synopsis: A farm worker says he was threatened by a man who escaped from Langi Kal Kal prison near Ballarat.

title.children: Prison escapee attacks Victorian farm worker

image.altText: A stylised portrait of LJ

props.synopsis: An Australian-first study finds evidence of previously undetected, long-term cognitive changes in women more than six months after they experienced repeated concussions and strangulation during intimate partner violence.

title.children: The hidden injuries linked to memory changes in family violence survivors

image.altText: Sam Groth with hand raised with political advertising behind him

props.synopsis: Sam Groth, the deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party, has announced he will not contest the upcoming state election in November, saying he made his decision after realising that some recent negative public pressure had come from within his own party.

title.children: Deputy Victorian Opposition Leader Sam Groth won't contest next election

image.altText: Three men stand in front of a lemon tree looking angry.

props.synopsis: The group posted CCTV footage on social media appearing to show a man breaking into an office in Carlton.

title.children: Police investigate burglary at offices of comedy troupe Sooshi Mango

image.altText: Two people hug wrapped in a Venezuelan flag.

props.synopsis: Australia's small but tight-knit community of Venezuelan-born residents is gathering to discuss the unfolding situation in their home country after the US captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

title.children: Relief, fear and uncertainty for Venezuelan community in Australia

image.altText: Image of a number of fallen trees in a green plantation.

props.synopsis: Questions are being raised about sustainable timber certification in Australia.

title.children: Sustainable timber certification under fire

image.altText: The front of the GrainCorp factory in Numurkah

props.synopsis: Fire crews put out a fire that was described as having the potential to cause an explosion early this morning.

title.children: Major fire at grain storage facility north of Shepparton

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old French man has been arrested at Sydney International Airport following an alleged sexual assault in Melbourne's CBD in the early hours of New Year's Day.

title.children: Man arrested at Sydney airport after alleged sexual assault in Melbourne

image.altText: Amanda pushes her daughter on a swing at a playground.

props.synopsis: While the exact number of pregnant women who are homeless in Victoria is unknown, experts say the outsized demand for specialty support services indicates more can be done.

title.children: Housing demand for pregnant homeless women outstrips supply, experts say

image.altText: A general view ahead of the round 24 AFL match between Essendon Bombers and Carlton Blues at the MCG.

props.synopsis: Phoenix Spicer, who played 12 AFL matches for North Melbourne, has died at the age of 23.

title.children: Former North Melbourne AFL player Phoenix Spicer dies aged 23

image.altText: A photo of a double story long hotel, with green pillars and a white fence, with a steel gate surrounding it,in a country town,

props.synopsis: For the first time in almost 140 years, Toora's historic pub did not trade over the festive season, leaving locals and visitors with nowhere to drink.

title.children: Summer is here but this town's pub is closed for the first time in 140 years

image.altText: Police at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police are searching for offenders, who are believed to have driven past in a silver SUV and fired shots at a young man, before fleeing the scene.

title.children: Teenager dies after shooting near police station in Melbourne's inner north

image.altText: Aunty Jemmes Handy is pictured outside wearing a black t-shirt and is facing the camera.

props.synopsis: A former director of an embattled Aboriginal organisation says the vote that removed her was fair and legitimate, and has asked the state government to intervene amid calls to re-run the vote.

title.children: 'A laughing stock': Elder and MDAS ex-board member calls for government intervention

image.altText: A baby echidna with soft fur instead of spines rests on a bed.

props.synopsis: With female echidnas seemingly creating burrows in random places at this time of the year, wildlife carers warn to keep an eye out for what might be disturbed while doing holiday work on your property.

title.children: Puggle trouble prompts warning to watch out for baby echidnas

image.altText: Two crashed cars on the Monash Freeway.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating an altercation potentially involving edged weapons after a collision on the Monash Freeway in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: People fight, flee scene after Melbourne freeway crash, police say

image.altText: An elevated shot of tightly packed black-roofed houses stretching into the distance.

props.synopsis: The red-hot Australian housing market is showing the first signs of easing since interest rates started rising in May 2022.

title.children: Not a 'blip': Sydney and Melbourne property prices go into reverse

image.altText: Four men start paddling on a boat made of cans in water at the beach

props.synopsis: From pint-sized penny farthings to tuna tosses, a beer can regatta to the Running of the Sheep, there's a regional festival for everyone's interests.

title.children: Add these must-do regional festivals to your 2026 calendar

image.altText: A police mug shot of a woman.

props.synopsis: Jean Lee and her two co-accused were executed for murder in 1950. Handwritten letters from the trio are among items publicly available for the first time since their trial captured the nation's attention.

title.children: Case file of last woman hanged in Australia released after 75 years

image.altText: Graffitied roller doors on Victoria Street.

props.synopsis: Richmond's Victoria Street, once a buzzing area home to dozens of restaurants and grocers, has seen better days. What can be done to bring it back to its bustling best?

title.children: This Melbourne suburb has been on the decline, but a new future beckons

image.altText: A police crime scene.

props.synopsis: Two men were taken to hospital with serious injuries after being stabbed in Carlton shortly before midnight.

title.children: Police investigate Melbourne NYE double stabbing

image.altText: Nine police surround one man (face not shown) as two of them put him in the back of a divvy van in a residential street.

props.synopsis: Police charge a man after a two-day pursuit that resulted in a police officer being injured and multiple police vehicles being rammed.

title.children: Man, 34, charged with 66 offences after police hunt in Latrobe Valley

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: A man and a woman will face court charged with numerous offences, including manufacturing unauthorised explosive devices.

title.children: Police find explosives, arrest two people in Bendigo suburb

image.altText: A man in a polo shirt in an old building standing beside a morse code machine

props.synopsis: Even as digital technology continues to evolve, "Morsecodians" aim to preserve a once-essential way to communicate across the world.

title.children: Morse code lovers and navy trainers persist with skill others deem a dying art

image.altText: A large silver truck drives off into a pink sunset.

props.synopsis: Australia's road transport industry is facing a growing driver shortage driven by an aging workforce and limited recruitment of younger people.

title.children: Truck driver shortage puts squeeze on Australia's supply chain

image.altText: Beth in a hard hat covered in soot

props.synopsis: TV presenter and former builder Barry Du Bois is lobbying Canberra for change.

title.children: First apprenticeship 'hell' for tradie who wants hazing to stop

image.altText: Nick McKenzie wearing a blue suit and tie

props.synopsis: Investigators from a taskforce targeting crime in the construction industry say a 31-year-old man threatened journalist Nick McKenzie in a Christmas Eve call.

title.children: Man charged with making threatening phone call to Melbourne journalist

image.altText: A photo of John Cain.

props.synopsis: Previously secret cabinet documents from the Labor governments of John Cain Jr and Joan Kirner have been released to the public for the first time.

title.children: Cabinet documents from one of Victoria's most influential governments released
